author: Richard Walker
title: Hornets week ahead: Opening day of 2015-16 season is Wednesday
text: Posted Oct. 25, 2015 at 10:35 am Updated at 10:37 AM THIS WEEK’S GAMES: Wednesday – at Miami, 7:30 p.m. Friday – at Atlanta, 8 p.m. Sunday – Atlanta, 2 p.m. MARQUEE MATCHUP: Monday vs. Atlanta Hawks – The 2015-16 season home opener comes against the defending Southeast Division champions – and two days after playing in Atlanta in the second game of the season. Charlotte went 2-2 against the Hawks last season, is 19-25 in the past 10 seasons and 44-57 all-time. The 101 contests is the most the franchise has played against any rival franchise. NOTABLE: Despite having a losing record overall (33-49), Charlotte went 8-8 against the Southeast Division last season. It marked only the third time since the franchise returned to the NBA in 2004 that the Hornets had gone .500 or better; Charlotte went 9-7 in 2006-07 and 10-6 in 2009-10…. In going 7-1 in the preseason, the Hornets had their best preseason record in franchise history…. In the preseason, four players averaged in double figures – Jeremy Lin (15.3 average), Kemba Walker (13.4), Nicolas Batum (13.0) and Al Jefferson (11.2). Tyler Hansbrough (10.0) was the top rebounder and Lin (3.8) the top passer.
